question: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) released a Joint Action Plan to prevent Drug abuse among children, along with which organisation?
option1: Ministry of Women and Child Development
option2: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights
answer: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights
explanation:
The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) along with the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) released a Joint Action Plan on the “Prevention of Drug and Substance Abuse among Children and Illicit Trafficking’’.
It proposed to include curriculum related to drug abuse by NCERT, CCTV cameras at Drug stores and establishing “Prahari clubs’’ to encourage children to monitor dug abuse in their schools and communities.
